headline: Ground Turkey Taco Meat
description: Make tasty ground turkey tacos with this spicy seasoning mix featuring chili powder, cumin, paprika, cayenne, garlic, and a touch of brown sugar.

video.description: Your ground turkey tacos will have amazing flavor and fewer calories because of the ground turkey! It is a little spicy, but our family enjoys it this way. Because it has so much flavor, you cannot even tell it's not ground beef.
video.name: Ground Turkey Taco Meat Recipe

name: Ground Turkey Taco Meat

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, oregano, and cayenne in a small bowl.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add ground turkey and cook, stirring to break up clumps, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in spice mixture and water. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 10 minutes.
Stir in cider vinegar and brown sugar; simmer until flavors combine, 3 to 4 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl.

review.reviewBody: Nice balance of seasoning ❤️

Wonderful recipe! I just added a can of rinsed pinto beans and a can of Rotel to your recipe to make a pot of cowboy beans for our supper. Your measurements for apple cider vinegar added brightness, and the brown sugar gave the right amount of sweetness. Thank You! This is a keeper!
Great spice level
Because it was a little spicy, next time I will not use as much chili powder or cayenne pepper. It was very good, however, you really do not realize it is turkey.
made it without the vinegar or sugar, it was awesome! what constitutes a serving tho? a cupful? how many grams? I made this as a part of meal prep
Delicious!

This was so fab. Super excellent. Using the same amounts given in the recipe i used various other chili powders—ancho, chipotle, de arbol and new mexico red. I didn’t think it needed sugar or vinegar, but definitely didn’t hurt it at all. I will make this over and over again.
Best taco meat recipe I’ve ever had, hands down. The flavor profile is unmatched.
My family usually always prefers ground beef but everyone was very pleased with recipe! I will be making it again!
Modified due to some allergies and placed it on some cauliflower tortillas. Excellent!
it was ok

I made the recipe as written and it tasted delicious! The brown sugar and cider vinegar are a nice touch. Great way to change up the Mexican style seasonings I normally use for ground turkey. I saved this recipe and will definitely make again!
Oh, wow. So delicious. I was surprised how well it turned out. My husband who prefers beef loved it too. I definitely would recommend trying this recipe out. You won’t be disappointed.
Awesome recipe!
I made the food. It taste good. I added cilantro, fresh tomato and sour cream with lemon. Thank you for the recipe.
I like it but need to cut the spices in half. It was bit overpowering.

Great recipe! Only change I made was adding chicken bone broth instead of water. We had romaine lettuce tacos and they were wonderful without the greasiness of ground beef. Next time I will add a little lime juice as another reviewer did.
Tasty! Don’t cook ground turkey too long, it will dry out. I added an extra tsp of taco seasoning mix, great on salads!
Delicious. Used half the chili powder and added to 1.5lbs ground turkey.
A really good and flavorful recipe. I swapped the onion powder for a small onion. I omitted the salt. I added a can of black beans and some corn. My family devoured this! It's a keeper.
Pretty good. I would cut the cayenne in half, 1.5x the sugar, and replace the water with broth if available.
My new favorite! I used this recipe to make hearty nachos with chips, salsa, sour cream, lettuce, shredded cheddar,…. So good! I will make again for sure!
This was really good just as is! Thanks for a delicious turkey taco dish!
Soooo good! My bf and I couldn’t stop eating it. Topped it with cheese and pico. Mmm
I also added onion and red, green and orange bell peppers. Yummy!

I was pleasantly surprised how good this was! I can't wait until I make it again. In the middle of making the taco meat, I realized I didn't have any cider vinegar, so I used plain white vinegar and added the juice of one lime. I topped my tacos off with black bean salsa, cheese and green onions. You can't tell it is turkey meat, these are so delicious!

I made this with things I keep on hand. I did not use garlic powder but fresh garlic. I gave up sugar for Lent so I also omitted the brown sugar and the vinegar as well. Not salty but super flavorful. For shells, I bought corn tortillas and fried them myself for hard shells and just warmed them for soft shells. Paired with Cuban black beans & cilantro lime rice. I’ll never buy the seasoning packs again.
We love this recipe. Just the right spices!

I will no longer purchase packets of taco seasonings anymore. It's a keeper that you can use with a salad, taco's, quesadilla's, and tostadas. Never added vinegar and brown sugar before, but it gives great flavor to the season's base.
Fantastic! I make this every other week or so.
Delicious!

I didn’t care for this, and either did my husband. I made it according to the recipe, no changes. I didn’t like the flavor of the sugar and vinegar at end - it made it almost barbecue-ish which made for a weird flavor once you put the other toppings on.
Really great seasoning!
Delicious and very easy. I added 1/4 sauteed sweet onion instead of onion powder.i liked the texture.
I like this so much that we make it once a week.

Made my whole family happy, which is VERY hard to do!!! I substituted the cider vinegar (ran out) with 1/3 cup tomato sauce. I have the 3 bears - my husband likes things very flavorful and spicy, my daughter likes it flavorful, and my son likes everything mild. This one satisfied all them! My husband just added a bit of hot sauce to his. 

I double the recipe and make extra now, and we use the leftover meat for nachos or mexican salads on a different night. Dinner for 2 nights!

I made this last night for the family. The only additions were Valdila onion and green pepper. I did not have garlic powder to used a little minced garlic. Turned out very well and I will use this recipe again.
Our go-to taco meat recipe. The seasoning blend is perfect! You definitely won’t miss the beef. This is WAY better!

The ground turkey I use is from Costco in a four pack. I believe one pack is about 1 lb. I used the amount of seasonings called for but halved the salt. I served with slaw and sour cream. Very good and now have made this twice.
Fabulous!!!

Made it as close as possible to the recipe (except I had just run out of brown sugar! So I used honey instead). Great flavor! The vinegar at the end adds a refreshing depth my turkey has always needed :)
This was outstanding! What great flavor. I need to make more next time because it only lasted one meal, no leftovers. Thank you for the recipe!

I cook just about every meal at our home. I'm extremely open to any suggested recipes. I do a lot of research and when looking for a taco meat recipe I came upon this one. I have to say this is the worst tasting taco meat I have ever made. My gut said it was way too much salt and why so much Chili powder? Well I made it anyways to give it a shot. My husband who will eat anything said it was dreadful. With that said, I will go back to my recipe that does not have Chili Powder nor is it overly salty like this one. This recipe MASKS the meat.

I had very little hope for turkey taco meat but then I found this recipe. 
I made 48oz of meat so I quadrupled all the measurements. My family doesn't like super spicy so I omitted the cayenne. We were out of onion powder so I replaced it with I full chopped onion which I cooked with the meat in the skillet. Surprisingly, my kids and I really enjoyed it! I was shocked! Thank you for sharing!

It came out soooo tasty! But I did make some changes to the spices. Instead of chilling powder I used taco seasoning and instead of cayenne pepper I used Cajun. Overall I kept everything the same and it was good. Definitely will make this recipe again.
Love this spice recipe! I usually add some Evil hot sauce and some diced green chilies and sub turkey meat for diced chicken.

There should be a HUGE note on the top about how spicy this is. It had a nice sweet heat flavor that was great, but after eating 1/4 of a taco your mouth, throat and lips are on fire! Had I known this, I would have made adjustments to the amount of certain spices. I'm not saying this tasted bad, I'm just saying there should be a warning on this so people who don't want their mouth to hurt after they eat these can make adjustments.
I omitted the chili powder for my kids. I've already made this again, due to the rave reviews from husband and two kids.
Excellent and delicious! A family fav now and My son's favorite!
Followed the recipe, except adding lime juice instead of the vinegar. It's delicious.
Very delicious. Everyone in the house loved it. I skipped the cayenne pepper due to my kids not liking spicy things.

I've made this several times. Love it!
Last time I made it I added a can of diced tomatoes with basil,oregano and garlic.
This is much better than packaged taco seasoning
Delicious! This is my go to seasoning when I want to make tacos.
I only put in 1 tsp of chili powder and it was awesome! My husband can’t eat spicy food & it had just enough flavor for him!
I love,love,love this recipe!
I made a few modifications but this was delicious. I added extra cumin, smokey paprika, lots of garlic and onion powder. Sooo good.
This is hands down the best taco meat I’ve ever made in my life. Wouldn’t change a thing!

This recipe is perfect as is! The only thing i did different was mixed the brown sugar into all the dry ingredients then i added the vinegar after the meat, water and seasoning was already simmering. That was only because i didn't read correctly. It smelled and tasted just like the packages you buy out of the store. Will use this again!

This recipe is excellent! In terms of spices I followed the recipe to a tee. When I made it the first time I found it came out a bit dry; for a richer and moister dish, I added more water and at the end a generous amount of apple cider vinegar as well as a bit more brown sugar. I make this at least a couple of times a month. Everyone loves it and it’s easily my favorite easy dish to make.
I should have made a double recipe!
This was tasty! I did cut back on the spice and salt the second time around but it was very good. It is so much better with the juice of a lime added.
I left out the vinegar and doubled the recipe for 2 lbs of turkey , very good my kids enjoyed it and liked it better than the package seasoning !

I was a little hesitant about the amount of spices used but I followed the recipe exactly - even down to the brown sugar & cider vinegar. It was delicious...none of the bland taste typically found with ground turkey. I served it with seasoned black beans, grated cheese, chopped onions, avocado, sour cream along with sour cream on the side.

I tried this based off the many positive reviews but beware - the reviewers that state that it is overpowering are very correct. If you make this, cut back on the chili powder and cumin to balance the flavors better. Famous Taco Seasoning Mix, on this website, is my favorite and I will not stray again.
This taco seasoning is so tasty! I added chopped red peppers, onions, and sweet grape tomatoes for visual appeal. Yum!
Very flavorful for ground turkey! I omitted the salt, oregano, and cayenne pepper. I swapped out the onion powder for 2 tablespoons of dried chopped onion and added one 8-oz can of tomato sauce.
Delicious!
I did not add the brown sugar...I did add one can RO*TEL (Diced Tomatoes and Green Chilies) - put this all on top of a mixed spring greens salad!
Left out the brown sugar (low carb) and it tastes amazing! Will make again. Also used 1 LB of turkey instead of just 12 oz -- perfectly spiced.
Hands down the best taco meat seasoning. The brown sugar and apple cider vinegar are important.

Delicious, but way too spicy!!! We love extremely spicy food and put hot sauce and jalapeños on just about everything. This recipe should come with a warning and glass of milk. This is one of the spiciest dishes we’ve ever eaten!
My husband didn’t even know it wasn’t beef! Excellent recipe! Thank you for sharing. Of course I also cooked 1 onion with it b/c we love onion (still used the onion powder).
Made as I ran out of taco seasoning and my family loved it.
Supreme blend .. dulls the turkey flavour / added kernel corn
It's not bad. But next time I think I'll try a bit less cumin and chili powder.
Great easy recipe! Family loved it. I may add a little less chili powder next time for my personal taste.

I try to follow these recipes as they are, otherwise how can you give an accurate review when you change half the recipe. I thought this was delicious exactly as it is and will definitely be making this again. I brought leftovers to work for lunch but didn't get to it until 2 days later but it was just as good as when it was first made.

Super flavorful and juicy tacos! I sautéed some onions and added garlic before I added the turkey to brown. I served made mine on lettuce and added avocado and tomatoes on top. They were SO good! I will definitely make these again!
So good! Definitely making again!
Absolutely delicious!! Loved it! Way better than using the taco seasoning loaded with MSG and all sorts of stuff. This is a hit
Holy *bleep*, this recipe surprised me. I was not expecting such a great flavor, and now my husband wants to make this our "go to" taco meat from now on. No complaints here, this is so good!
Went a little heavier on the spices bc I have 16 oz. of turkey. So good!! I am going to make a big batch and freeze it for easy dinners.
A keeper! I went a little lighter on the spicy herbs for my son. Still great.
Excellent recipe! Much better than the store spice packages. Followed the recipe but added green onion. Yum!
Super good. Will totally make again!!

You cannot tell it isnt beef ! this recipe is insane for real i have no idea how it works but it does!! a staple for my recipe box ! cant wait to share this recipe with family and friends! I always up the garlic, and use smoked paprika ontop of the ingredient list for a nice spice. Also, i add dried onions (sometimes we just dont have enough time), and towards the end i add fresh chopped parsley to the pan as its shimmering for a nice pop of color. BEST TACO RECIPE EVER
Very tasty!

Probably the best taco recipe I've ever made. I usually don't like adding sugar to my recipes, but decided to do it since I added the vinegar... I thought they probably needed to go together. And it didn't seem like too much. In the end, a really great blend... VERY VERY good. Kids loved it. BTW - I don't like turkey!
Awesome and the spicy-ness is perfect!
awesome recipe - hit with the family. Served with all the fixings
I didn't have any cider vinegar on hand and I opted out on the brown sugar. I added drained diced stewed tomatoes instead of water. Yum! I will be making this again.
i omit the cayanne pepper-my family is not so spicy! So good a weekly staple
Loved it. Will definitely make again.
Way to camaoflage that ground turkey! So very good.

Amazing! Best spice mixture for tacos I've ever tried. I half the sugar but keep everything the same. When I make the taco, sometimes I put quacamole, a little cilantro, sour cream, and a little squeeze of lime. Heaven.

Love this recipe. I normally don’t cook with ground turkey and I found this to be just the right amount of Sweet and spicy just as if I was going to make it with ground beef . I highly recommend you try it

Followed exactly- meh
Wont make again
Came out great tasting perfect spice!
loved it , a little spicy though even though only used 1/8 of cayenne. would do it again any day!
